Name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 2 – Tradition: La Guadeloupe
Description:
The Conficulture Quiz is a card game to be played with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Discover the TRADITION of the "Guadeloupe" destination while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Your set of 33 cards is supplied to you in a plastic box, practical for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.


Le Quiz Conficulture est un jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis.  Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Partez à la découverte de la TRADITION de la destination « Guadeloupe » en vous amusant.

Votre jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

—description from the publisher

Name: Crystal Palace: Cards no 31
Description:
Two promo cards, with number 31, first given to the first 300 people who registered for the digital event Camp Capstone.

The invention is the Bandage-o-Matic, the person is Elizabeth Blackwell.

Name: Greyhounds Profi-Spiel
Description:
Greyhounds Professional game for "old hands".
This variant allows the bookmaker to set the winning and entry rates for the race himself. The space quotas cannot be changed.
These flexible win and run-in odds give the bookmaker more opportunities to better influence racing and betting events. He can prove particularly "strong" dogs with low betting odds.

Name: I Wish I Didn't Know!
Description:
ADULTS ONLY: This game contains mature content and is designed for ages 17+. NOT intended for children. Trust us.

I WISH I DIDN’T KNOW: Compete with your friends and family by guessing which gross fact is actually true. Just read off the answer choices and hear your audience groan! By the end, you’ll all be experts on all things you wish you didn’t know. Brought to you by the creators of What Do You Meme.

HOW TO PLAY: Players rotate drawing a trivia card while the rest of the group competes to guess which answer is correct. Once everyone has guessed, the judge reveals the correct answer and awards one point to those who chose correctly. The player with the most points at the end of the game takes the crown.

WHAT’S INSIDE: Contains 500 trivia cards plus instructions. Printed on premium playing cards (thick with gloss finish), shrink-wrapped in a custom box.

—description from the designer

Name: Puerto Rico
Description:
In Puerto Rico, players assume the roles of colonial governors on the island of Puerto Rico. The aim of the game is to amass victory points by shipping goods to Europe or by constructing buildings.

Each player uses a separate small board with spaces for city buildings, plantations, and resources. Shared between the players are three ships, a trading house, and a supply of resources and doubloons.

The resource cycle of the game is that players grow crops which they exchange for points or doubloons. Doubloons can then be used to buy buildings, which allow players to produce more crops or give them other abilities. Buildings and plantations do not work unless they are occupied by workers.

During each round, players take turns selecting a role card from those on the table (such as "Trader" or "Builder"). When a role is chosen, every player gets to take the action appropriate to that role. The player that selected the role also receives a small privilege for doing so - for example, choosing the "Builder" role allows all players to construct a building, but the player who chose the role may do so at a discount on that turn. Unused roles gain a doubloon bonus at the end of each turn, so the next player who chooses that role gets to keep any doubloon bonus associated with it. This encourages players to make use of all the roles throughout a typical course of a game.

Puerto Rico uses a variable phase order mechanism in which a "governor" token is passed clockwise to the next player at the conclusion of a turn. The player with the token begins the round by choosing a role and taking the first action.

Players earn victory points for owning buildings, for shipping goods, and for manned "large buildings." Each player's accumulated shipping chips are kept face down and come in denominations of one or five. This prevents other players from being able to determine the exact score of another player. Goods and doubloons are placed in clear view of other players and the totals of each can always be requested by a player. As the game enters its later stages, the unknown quantity of shipping tokens and its denominations require players to consider their options before choosing a role that can end the game.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Fearless Creatures
Description:
Fearless Creatures is a lightweight, fun (yet kinda silly) battle game between creatures that might not always get a chance to battle in real life. It's also meant to be educational, as in "What is this creature?" or "Where is this place?" and then you can learn more about them. The game is best played in small groups of 2-4 people, ideally a family setting that spans generations. Fearless Creatures is a print-on-demand card game.

A dice battle game between fearless creatures. Use action cards to play creatures from your hand, battle with any creatures that are in play, and draw cards. Each creature's ability are described on the card. Roll battle dice. Collect victory tokens when you send creatures to the discard pile. The player with the most victory tokens wins.

All creatures have unique descriptions and capabilities. Lots of creatures have the ability to band together (as herds, swarms, pods, flocks, etc.) and when they are banded together they battle as a group. Damage to creatures that band together is still determined by a creature's individual strength. It is possible possible for a large group of creatures to cause a lot of damage, but also to take a lot of damage that is applied to more than one creature in the group.

Name: Political Mess
Description:
A politician-laying, vote-grabbing micro puzzle game designed by Daryl Chow.

In this rapid but surprisingly deep tile-laying area control game, players lay cards trying to control democracy monument, while strategically trying to place their politician in secure locations to protect their valuable rights. The player who controls the best and most monuments at the end of the game wins!

Name: Village of Legends: The Reaper's Hand
Description:
An expansion for Village of Legends: The Reaper's Hand, adds more cards, 3 Heroes, more abilities, and a new co-op and solo mode to the game.

Players will be called on to make choices which will lead them down numerous paths, bouncing from chapter to chapter and facing the challenges based both their character type, the choices they have made and, as always, fate could rest on the roll of the dice.

-description from designer

Name: Jollywood
Description:
You are a film producer and become rich by making films and releasing them to the public.  But you have to compete with other producers in the cut-throat entertainment business.

The purpose of the game is to build a tableau of several films, each consisting of a series of production cards. There are Genre, Script, Director, Actor, Staff, Prop, and Location cards. You need a Genre or Script card, a Director, one or more Actors, and one or more Staff to complete a film, which you can then release by closing it off with a special Release card.

The players have their own decks of cards. On your turn, after taking one card from your deck, you may buy 1 or 2 additional cards from any deck or discard pile and then, if you want, play 1 or 2 cards from your hand. At the end of each turn, you then receive box office money earned by your released films and pay the ongoing costs of your open productions. In case of need, you may borrow money that you will have to return with interest at the end of the game.

Instead of adding cards to your productions, you can discard them to get instant cash or to interfere with other players’ productions. The game ends when a player releases a pre-determined number of films. After a final scoring and the distribution of awards to the best producers, the player with most money wins.

The current version of Jollywood includes four genres: Science Fiction, Thriller, Historical, and War.

-description from designer

Name: Martial Art: Clans
Description:
The great clans rise for war in this expansion for Martial Art. Clans introduces unique powers, leaders, and dojos.

Each player chooses a clan at the start of the game. Your clan gives you a special power that you can use to build your hand or increase your strength in battle. The 8 clan powers add an incredible new level of strategic depth to your games of Martial Art.

Clan leaders are exceptionally powerful cards which whole strategies can be built around. You gain your clan leader by winning a new type of land card called a dojo. The dojo itself adds interesting new decisions to 3- and 4-player games. Which is more valuable to you, a higher point land or a dojo which gives you your clan leader? The choice is yours.

-description from designer

Name: Aarcana Inquisitions
Description:
Aarcana Inquisitions, is a game of necessary cooperation and occasional, strategic back stabbing. Players will quickly find that it is a matter of life and death to work together to survive the hunt that they have been tasked with but when bills are tallied, only one player can be the best.

Each player will come to the table with an entirely unique custom character that has taken on a bounty against a randomly generated scenario and a host of powerful creatures. 
Through the course of the game players will keep a running tally of their billable accomplishments and once the objective has been satisfied or all of the players have died a horrible gruesome death, the players will compare their bills to see who is (or was) the best Hunter.

Make no mistake, the monsters in this world will kill you and the Hunter who claimed to be your comrade might do the same. Characters earn their living by taking bounties from different guilds and not all guilds are cut from an honorable cloth. At any time a player may turn their sights on another player if they think it will further their own goals. Some characters may see comparing bills at the end of a hunt as a friendly competition among peers but there are certainly others that see competition as a thing to be eliminated.

There is strength in numbers, and players will need every advantage they can muster against the other-worldly threats to this realm. But how much do you trust the Hunter next to you?

—description from the publisher

Name: Project L: Kickstarter Edition
Description:
The Deluxe Kickstarter edition supports 6 players (retail edition supports 4) and comes with an additional 45 pieces.

About the game:
Project L is a fast-paced, tile-matching brain burner with triple-layer 3D puzzles and lovely acrylic pieces. Challenge your friends to a game of simple design but intricate gameplay that makes a lasting impression!

The core of the game lies in using your pieces to complete puzzles. Starting with just two basic pieces, you use three actions every turn to develop a powerful engine. With more pieces of various types, you can efficiently complete even the most difficult puzzles. The puzzles you complete award you points or new pieces to further fuel your engine. Can you outsmart your opponents?

Name: Green, Chems & Steel
Description:
As an agent for hire you’re tasked with expiring a number of Synthetic beings known to be operating in the City.

During the game you will visit locations and perform tasks in the optimum order to bring in the most Synthetics before the other agents.

Green, Chems & Steel is played over a number of rounds until one player has expired the majority of the synthetics.

On your turn you draw 1 location card, plus the number of location bonuses on your player card.  You also collect 1 resource of your choice, plus the number of resource bonuses on your player card.  You then spend resources to complete the locations cards in the order of your choice.

Some locations will cause you to deactivate your player bonuses, others will set traps for other players.  Any locations you cannot complete may provide bonuses for the other player(s).

At the end of your turn you discard all resources down to 1 plus any discard bonuses on your player card.  All the completed locations are discarded and the next player takes their turn.

The game ends instantly if a player has expired the majority of synthetics.

Name: Red Winter: The Soviet Attack at Tolvajärvi, Finland (Second Edition)
Description:
Red Winter: Expanded 2nd Edition

This 2nd edition game is more than just a reprint of the 2012 CSR Award winner for best WW2 boardgame. It features an all-new battle, complete with its own map and countersheet.

The Battle of Kelja (December 25-27, 1939) now compliments the original Tolvajärvi battle. Kelja presents a challenge that is unique to the game system but certainly not the Winter War: a large-scale river crossing. The length of the new map is bisected by a wide, frozen river that functions as a frozen lake.

Kelja is a logical fit for the game system in terms of length and scale. At three days, it provides a shorter play experience than the five-day Tolvajärvi battle. The unit density is only moderately higher than that of the previous battle but still limited to a single countersheet, and the featured river crossing offers a unique game situation, providing both players with plenty of decisions and challenges.

Lest the battle become a “one trick pony,” plenty of options are available to both players, including variable unit setups, multiple victory conditions, variable reinforcement units, and smaller scenarios including some hypothetical situations.

Mechanics

Central to play is the Action Phase, wherein each unit may choose only one from several possible actions: move/assault, attempt recovery, dig in, or take replacement steps. This makes for some very tense decisions for both players. It also conveniently moves the game along at a brisk pace.

Combat is fast and well integrated. Units may voluntarily perform combats against adjacent enemies (two-way firefights, which utilize a CRT), conduct assaults as part of movement, or make ranged attacks at a distance of two or more hexes. The “grand tactical” scale of 425 yards per hex yields ranges of 2 hexes for light machineguns, 3 hexes for heavy machineguns and T-26 tanks, 6 hexes for medium mortars, and 12 hexes for heavy mortars. Artillery is somewhat abstracted, being handled as off-map batteries which can strike any hex on the map. Players allocate barrages as they see fit, while keeping an eye on their ammunition.

The rules for night turns provide several layers of strategic depth by means of individually simple mechanics. During each night turn, which simulates a 12 hour period, units have double their normal movement allowances. This means combat units can exploit gaps in the enemy’s frontline, cross lakes, or execute wide flanking maneuvers. However, such ambitious units are susceptible to “Sub-Zero” step losses, simulating frostbite, desertion, and poor morale from the extreme weather conditions. Whether or not each stack (note: stack, not individual unit) receives a step loss is determined by a simple 50-50 die roll. The interaction of these night rules means that ambitious players may be encouraged to push their luck and gain the upper hand during night turns, all while the system simultaneously encourages players to “do nothing” and even huddle their units together into stacks during night turns to reduce total step losses. The end result is that the system nicely mirrors the night actions of the actual battle.

The implications of the night rules don’t stop there. Skilled players will plan ahead for a night turn by positioning their units favorably during the preceding dusk turn, so they won’t need to relocate and possibly take step losses. This nuance can (and should be) exploited by the Finns, who move second in the turn sequence. The Soviet player has the option to build bonfires to avoid sub-zero attrition losses, but in doing so his units become very inviting targets for Finnish assaults. All this gives both players a lot of choices, without burdening them with cumbersome rules or tables.

—description from the publisher

Name: Drop Zone: Southern France
Description:
Drop Zone: Southern France is a fast-playing (about 2 hours), company-level game of the Allied airborne assault (code-named Operation RUGBY) that spearheaded Operation DRAGOON, the Invasion of Southern France—the Second D-Day, August 15th, 1944. The game can be played face-to-face, by 2, 3, or 4 players or solitaire (as the Allies). Early on the morning of D-Day, the allied First Airborne Task Force (1st ABTF) parachuted a dozen miles behind the Riviera landing beaches to seize key towns and road junctions, to prevent the German occupation forces from counter-attacking the amphibious landing, and to facilitate the advance of Allied forces. The 4:00 AM parachute drop was badly scattered due to an unexpected dense fog bank that blanketed the battlefield. Drop Zone: Southern France covers the first two days of this airborne operation in six tense turns, when the American and British paratroopers and glider-men fought surrounded and alone, supported only by French resistance bands.

The game board is a hex map of the Argens and Naturby River valleys and surrounding areas in Provence, Southern France, covering the area of operations. Each hex measures about 500 meters across. The key towns, villages, roads, rivers, and bridges that were fought over are indicated. The counters portray companies and company-sized units of allied paratroopers and glidermen, French resistance bands, German Infantry, and a few small armor units on both sides. Assets depict fire support units (artillery, heavy mortars, and anti-tank guns) as well as key capabilities (such as reconnaissance and seizing initiative).

Drop Zone: Southern France shines in its depiction of the fog of war (both literal and figurative)--unit type and strength is concealed until revealed in combat. On the first day, Allied parachute companies begin scattered across the board with minimal strength. German reinforcements arrive in a random fashion, often surprising and disrupting the plans of the opponent as well as the controlling player. The correlation of forces ebbs and flows as the Allies gradually build up their parachute companies and gliders deliver reinforcements and heavy weapons. Meanwhile, German reinforcements steadily increase in quantity and quality. The chit pull activation system adds another level of uncertainty. By D+1, the second day, both sides have gained in strength and acquire more powerful assets, leading to larger, bloodier battles as time runs out to achieve victory. It often comes down to the final roll of the dice.

-description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Fantastic Factories: Manufactions
Description:
Manufactions is an expansion to Fantastic Factories that introduces all new blueprints, contractors, vitamin resources, and corporate factions that grant players unique powers.

—description from the publisher
Families: Misc: Watch It Played How To Videos

Name: Guess Ball
Description:
A sponsor marks with erasable markers on the board. The combination must match the challenge levels below:

Level 1. Fill in 4 places with 1 color.
Level 2. Fill in 6 places with 2 color.
Level 3. Fill in 9 places with 3 color.

Next, the sponsor presents the card to the respondent for whom to remember the combination and repeat the scene with beads in 10-15 seconds. Then, Role Exchange. The one who remember that the best wins!

—description from the back of the box

Name: Raumdomino
Description: The room domino includes a basic set with two series of 8 cubes each. The domino of space is the departure of the domino game from the second to the third dimension. The use of three-color patterned color cubes creates the most amazing buildings with incredible colors and shapes. The basic set includes two series of 8 cubes each in four different color mixes, each with a three-color pattern.

Name: Pocket Investigations: Alchymia
Description:
Pocket Investigations is a series of "escape boxes", i.e. cooperative board games that are based on escape games, but playable at home.

In the scenario "Alchymia", the players try to make the recipe for the Philosopher's Stone.

Name: Daimyo's Fall: Dice Tuners – Paradox Pop Idol
Description:
Some of the girls we already met before decided to break the circle and prepare something beyond everyone’s imagination!

The fun fact is that they actually had the same dream during the same night: they were wearing strange clothes, performing on a stage filled with lights and there was a crowd screaming their names louder and louder! Was that just a coincidence?

After the endless multitude of Kami crafted the universe, they also ordained the mysterious flow of time… Is it possibile to transcend time and see, through dreams, alternate realities?

You asked for an add on, and here it is! This super special Kickstarter exclusive promo pack introduces powerful heroes with unique abilities and new strategy cards to overwhelm your opponents... with grace, style, and brand new aesthetics that you don’t want to miss!

—description from the publisher

Name: Les Jeux Conficulture: Episode 2 – Tradition: La Martinique
Description:
The Conficulture Quiz is a card game to be played with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

Discover the TRADITION of the "Martinique" destination while having fun.

If a player/team gets the correct answer with the first clue, they keep the card and get 2 more random cards. If they get the answer after the second clue, they received the card plus 1 random card. If they get it after the third clue, they keep just that card.

Game end can be when a team acquires a certain number of points (cards) or when the deck is depleted. Player/team with the most points, wins.

Your set of 33 cards is supplied to you in a plastic box, practical for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.

—description from the publisher (translated)


Le Quiz Conficulture est un jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis.  Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Partez à la découverte de la TRADITION de la destination « Martinique » en vous amusant.

Votre jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

—description from the publisher

Name: Histoire des Marrons: Episode 1
Description:
The Quiz Histoire des Marrons is a card game to be played with family or friends. On each card, guess the correct answer using 3 clues.

You all know the history of slavery and the slave trade, but do you know the history of resistant peoples in the Americas and the Caribbean? The true abolitionists who fought against the slavers and created independent nations at the heart of colonial empires.
Thanks to the HISTOIRE DES MARRONS quiz card game you will learn in a fun way about the life of Negro Maroons.

Each set of 33 cards is supplied to you in a plastic box, practical for storing your quiz and protecting it during transport.


Le Quiz Histoire des Marrons est un jeu de cartes à jouer en famille ou entre amis.  Sur chaque carte, devinez la bonne réponse à l’aide de 3 indices.

Vous connaissez tous et toutes l’Histoire de l’esclavage et de la traite négrière, mais connaissez-vous l’Histoire des peuples résistants dans les Amériques et les Caraïbes ? Les véritables abolitionnistes qui luttèrent contre les esclavagistes et créèrent des nations indépendantes au cœur des empires coloniaux.
Grâce au jeu de cartes quiz HISTOIRE DES MARRONS vous allez apprendre de façon ludique sur la vie des Nègres Marrons.

Chaque jeu de 33 cartes vous est fourni dans une Boite plastique, pratique pour ranger votre quizz et le protéger lors des transports.

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Koers-Course
Description:
Cycling, where heroism, passion and fighting spirit come together. Meandering roads through rolling landscapes, history, symbolism and solidarity among the fans make cycling probably the most beautiful sport.

Riders who suffer, looking for the finish line. Worn-out bodies on wretched cobblestones and slopes, weave their way between the rows of thick supporter mass towards eternal fame. That is cycling!

Monopoly Koers-Course is the ideal way to relive the most famous passages of your favourite spring classics. Just think of legendary duels on La Redoute, the marches on ‘De Muur’ or that one flat tyre at Carrefour de l’Arbre. Visit the Kwaremont square, go for a spin on the Vélodrome of Roubaix, climb the Poggio and get a victory bonus! This Monopoly edition brings you to all of the beauty that the spring races have to offer.

Monopoly Koers Course will be released in a limited edition of just 2000

—description from the publisher

Name: Monopoly: Citroën Origins
Description:
On the centenary of the brand, Citroën and Monopoly team up to offer you the most famous board games.

It was during the 2019 Rétromobile show, Citroën launched its own edition of the famous board game Monopoly.

This edition called Monopoly Citroën Origins is in the colours of Citroën, with the historical models of the brand on the boxes of the board game and specific cards.

The traditional tokens are replaced by vehicles of the Citroën brand. We can find series models such as 2CV, 5 HP or Traction, but also concept cars such as Cxperience or C-Métisse. The property cards are in keeping with the theme of this edition.


À l'occasion du centenaire de la marque, Citroën et Monopoly s'associent pour vous proposer le plus célèbre des jeux de société.

C'est lors du salon Rétromobile 2019 que Citroën a lancé sa propre édition du célèbre jeu de société Monopoly.

Cette édition baptisée Monopoly Citroën Origins est aux couleurs de Citroën, avec les modèles historiques de la marque. On peut trouver des modèles de série tels que 2CV, 5 CV ou Traction, mais aussi des concept cars comme Cxperience ou C-Métisse. Les cartes de propriété s'inscrivent dans le thème de cette édition.

Pour gagner la partie, il faudra savoir acheter, spéculer, vendre mais surtout négocier. Mais attention à la banqueroute, à vous de bien choisir le chemin à suivre pour ruiner les autres joueurs et arriver premier !

Name: Monopoly: Nürburgring
Description:
People, myth and engines - that is the story of the racetrack that opened in 1927. The Nordschleife - reverently christened “Green Hell” by Jackie Stewart - is one of the most beautiful and notorious racetracks in the world. Today the Nürburgring is much more: a versatile event and experience location for fans, families and companies - a place for unforgettable experiences.

Now it's your turn: Go on a journey through the “Green Hell” and 90 years of Ring history. "Experience" the unique sections of the route that make the heart of every motorsport fan beat faster. Meet racing heroes as well as legendary events from back then and take a look behind the scenes of today's racetrack.

But beware! Due to the spectacular route through the Eifel forests, the Nordschleife is considered the most demanding racetrack in the world. Only those who pay attention and know the limits can become a true “ring master”.

Free the ring for your journey of discovery: with the MONOPOLY edition of the Nürburgring.


Menschen, Mythos und Motoren – das ist die Geschichte der 1927 eröffneten Rennstrecke. Die Nordschleife – von Jackie Stewart ehrfurchtsvoll „Grüne Hölle“ getauft – ist eine der schönsten und berüchtigtsten Rennstrecken weltweit. Heute ist der Nürburgring noch viel mehr: Eine vielseitige Event- und Erlebnislocation für Fans, Familien und Firmen – ein Ort für unvergessliche Erlebnisse.

Jetzt bist du dran: Gehe auf die Reise durch die „Grüne Hölle“ und 90 Jahre Ring-Historie. „Erfahre“ die einzigartigen Streckenabschnitte, die das Herz jedes Motorsport-Fans höher schlagen lassen. Begegne Rennfahrer-Helden sowie legendären Ereignissen von damals und blicke hinter die Kulissen der Rennstrecke von heute.

Aber Vorsicht! Aufgrund der spektakulären Streckenführung durch die Eifelwälder gilt die Nordschleife als die anspruchsvollste Rennstrecke der Welt. Nur wer aufpasst und die Limits kennt, kann zum wahren „Ring-Meister“ werden.

Ring frei für deine Entdeckungsreise: mit der MONOPOLY-Edition des Nürburgrings.

Name: D6: Shadow of the Dragon Booster Pack
Description: This booster pack contains 8 new hero cards, 8 matching standees, 4 new Advantage cards, and 3 new Heroic Quest cards to enhance your D6 adventure.

Name: Bluebell
Description:
Deep forest in England.
The fairies celebrate their reunion on the Bluebell Carpet.

The player has two cards.
Play one or discard one on your turn.
Cards are stacked seasonally and returned to the deck in winter.
You will receive harvest tokens in the fall, but you may lose them.
If you run out of tokens and cannot pay, the round ends and you are the loser.
The loser gives the winner a "Bluebell" and the player who receives the two "blue bells" wins the game.

-description from designer

Name: Heroes Call
Description:
A quasi-cooperative, monster slaying, hero (deck) building, worker placement game for 2-4 players.

In the land of Zug, being a hero is a way of life! Children spend their days training to defeat the monsters that inhabit the surrounding wilderness in seemingly unending numbers. As a right of passage, all young adults must head out in to the wilderness and survive an adventure of epic proportions. Those who return become Heroes and spend the rest of their days telling the tales of the harrowing creatures and near defeat experienced.

You are one such group of young adults, ready to forge your own story! With the help of a few apprentices you will depart the safety and comfort of your village and embark upon an epic adventure.

Defeat the Big Boss and survive to tell your tale! Fail, and fall into obscurity.

—description from the publisher

Name: Golden Age of Piracy: 1718
Description:
The Golden Age of Piracy - 1718 is an old-school style Tactical level Solitaire board-wargame of action and adventure, with a bit of wargame and RPG elements mixed in. An open-ended sandbox style game where the pirate captain may choose his own path.

Set in the Caribbean Islands during the year 1718, as a pirate captain, you will attempt to build your wealth by attacking merchant ships and selling their goods, by attacking and pillaging towns, kidnapping or assassinating a town governor or his daughter, gambling in a tavern, and by recovering buried treasure from acquired maps.

The player moves his pirate ship's game counter across the Caribbean map, traveling around and searching for merchant ships to take attack, visiting the pirate town of Nassau to buy and sell goods, plus repair the ship. The player may also construct a hidden pirate haven where he may store stolen goods and booty, plus repair his ship at no cost.

The ultimate goal of the game is to save up enough booty in order to buy your pardon before the Royal Navy invades Nassau. Will you succeed, or be hanged for piracy?

—description from the designer

Name: Phantom Feud
Description:
“Ghosts battle it out inside a house by trapping each other behind walls. The last ghost still able to move through the house wins the right to haunt it for all eternity!”

2-players purple and green, ages 8+
Played on a 10x10 square board.
4 pawns (ghosts) to a side in two colors and supply of tile squares divided diagonally in half, green on one side and purple on the other.

Setup
The board starts out empty. Players in turn add a ghost to an empty square until all 4 of their ghosts are on the board.

Play
Green moves first. Turns then alternate.

On a turn, a player moves a ghost in his color in a straight orthogonal or diagonal line across empty squares or through tiles whose friendly side is facing towards the moving ghost ending the move on an empty square. Then, the player must place a tile on an empty square which is on the same straight orthogonal or diagonal line as the destination square of the last moved ghost. A ghost cannot move through tiles whose enemy side is facing towards them nor can they move along the dividing line of a tile or jump over other ghosts.

The last ghost to move wins.

Name: CrissCross Hex
Description:
CrissCross Hex is an abstract tile-laying game in which the players race across a board consisting of 271 hexagonal cells to pick up victory-point tiles.  You win if you have the highest number of victory points at the end of the game.

There are three types of tiles: path tiles that let you move your meeple across the board, point tiles that let you earn victory points, and end tiles. At set-up, the players place their markers at the edge of the board and identify their destinations at the other end the board with the end tiles. The point tiles are placed at random on 12 defined cells of the board.

On your turn,  you place path tiles on the board towards your destination and then use them as stepping stones for your marker. While you move your marker, you may also take advantage of paths laid by other players and, when that happens, you may replace already laid tiles with path tiles that have a higher level of connectivity.

When your marker steps onto a point tile, you pick it up and keep it till the end of the game. The game ends when a player reaches her destination after collecting a pre-defined number of point tiles.

CrissCross Hex includes several features that make it more interesting without significantly increasing its randomness:
1. Three pairs of “teleportation” cells let you jump across the board.
2. Secret bonus card make some point tiles more valuable.
3. Action cards let you break some of the rules.

-description from designer

Name: the memory games
Description:
An all time classic, the memory or matching card game, is gone wild, with different levels and ways of playing. This game, made with abstract images, is going to challenge your focus and creativity to be able to remember and get the most matching pairs and win the game.

A fun way to train your mind while having fun with friends and family.

Content: 54 cards. 1 Instructions.

How to play:
Players take turns choosing two cards and turning them over, if the cards match the player keeps the pair, and plays again choosing two more cards. If the cards chosen don’t match, once all players have seen the images, the player returns them to the face down position and  the next player takes a turn.
All players should watch the cards being turned over in order to memorize the image and location of the cards.
The player with the most matching pairs is the winner.

Levels of difficulty 
1.One colour. 
Choose a colour, separate the rest of the coloured cards from the game, place the 18 cards face down and play the memory game searching for the 9 pairs. 
2. Bi-colour 18. 
Select two colours and choose nine different images in each colour, remove the rest of the cards from the game, place the 18 cards face down and play the memory game searching for the 9 pairs of the same image in the two different colours.
3. Bi-colour 36. 
Select two colours and all the cards in each colour, remove the rest of the cards from the game, place the 36 cards face down and play the memory game searching for the 9 pairs of the same image and colour.
 4. Bicolor 54. 
Play with all 54 cards, searching for pairs of the same image and colour.
5. Bicolor mix 54. 
Play with all 54 cards, searching for pairs of the same image never in the same colour. Players will score as follows: 
Blue - green 5 pt. 
Red - blue 3 pt. 
Red - green 2 pt.
Same color  1pt
The player with the highest score wins the game.

Other games:
6. Tricolor 27. 
Remove half of the pack so that there is only 1 card of each colour and image remaining so you Play the game with 27 cards, choosing 3 cards each turn, try to locate the same image in all 3 colours.

7. Robo trio 27. 
This game is played with 27 cards. Take the 9 images in each colour, shuffle and place face down. Players take turns, choosing two cards,  once you have located three of a kind shout trio. If you fail to find all three you miss a go. If another player shouts Trio,he may play after the current players turn. When you find a trio, you take another turn. The player with most trios wins the game.

8. Colour Battle. 
Playing with all 54 cards, each player or team chooses a colour, making three teams (or three players). Each team must try to find all pairs of their chosen colour before the others. Each team can take pairs of other teams leaving them with less pairs to win the game. Remember everytime you find a pair, you take another turn.

Name: Kuzushi Hugs & Kisses
Description:
Kuzushi (coo-zoo-she) "Hugs & Kisses" is easy to learn and challenging to master. It's a portable game of balance and control that keeps you on your toes. You and your opponent place "Hugs & Kisses" (X & O cards) to build and control a 6x6 board. Bases influence adjacent squares and flags show who has the most bases nearby. Win by filling the board with more cards of your color or be the first to play your last card.

-description from publisher's website

Name: Hack My Password
Description:
Step into the shoes of a hacker. Try to break through your opponents firewall and decode their password before they manage to hack you! The first player to hack their opponents password or reach the finish line wins! The difficulty level on this game can be adjusted. You can also play this game in two teams.

Players are given topic cards that they use to choose their words. Words are then scrambled, hidden behind player screens. On a player's turn they guess a letter and if matched, opponent reveals all matching letters in their password. Optionally a guess can be made that has to match the two words in their unscrambled form.

Name: Cartographers: New Discoveries
Description:
Expansion consisting of:

- Cartographers: Ambush Mini Expansion
- a pad of the old maps from the original base game
- a pad of the new maps. The new map shows the Tabula Rasa card on one side. On the back is the H + C game board that Hunter and Cron used to play on CONspiracy 3. The plan offers a new starting point to start playing immediately. Rules from the base game apply as normal.

Name: Doomtown: Welcome to Deadwood
Description:
Welcome to Deadwood is Pine Box Entertainment's fifth expansion for Doomtown.

A small determined posse moves on from Gomorra and Tombstone, riding toward their destiny in a boomtown surrounded by the Black Hills of the Dakota badlands.  Meanwhile, Jonah Essex continues to flee powerful enemies. Is he prepared for an unexpected welcome in Deadwood ?

This new Doomtown expansion features 4 copies of 56 new cards, including historical places and people including Seth Bullock, Al Swearengen, The Gem Theater, and the No. 10 Saloon.

-description from publisher

Name: HoverDome
Description:
Welcome to the HoverDome!

You are an elite battle racer, ready to crush the competition using next-gen hover tech.

The HoverDome is configured in its infamous Martin track: The Red Canyon Run. Outmaneuver your rivals through deadly curves and tricky short-cuts, dodge a vicious arsenal of power-ups and turrets, unleash your own brand of hell, all the while keeping your bike in top form and at optimal speeds.

Unleashing maximum firepower! Dominate with strategy! Claim your victory!

---

Each turn provides interesting choices of movement, defense, and offense. Simple dynamics create rich strategic options to master. The fast-paced gameplay scales with simple rule changes to keep the fun for families with children to adult gamer groups. Now included: new two player mode!

-description from designer

Name: Bolt Action: Tank War – US Starter Set
Description:
What used to be one of the most numerous tanks during the war, the M4 Sherman saw battle all over the world. Forming the main battle lines for the British, American and filling in Soviet gaps, the M4 Sherman created the standard that tanks needed to beat. Ahead of the front line, use the M18 Hellcat to scout ahead and outmanoeuvre your opponents.

As typical of US doctrine, armoured divisions had a tank destroyer division attached alongside for long-term usage making this bundle ideal for those who choose to be historically accurate. This bundle also gives you a 1000+ point force, which is capable leading a direct assault or supporting the forward units, flexible for any situation on the battlefield.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Bolt Action: Tank War – German Starter Set
Description:
Limited steel resources forced Germany's hand to create monstrous tanks, vehicles capable of taking on whole squadrons on their own and coming out on top. Spearheading this assault is the Panther, boasting tough front armour, making it the ideal candidate to take any force head on. Bringing up the rear is the mechanical king of Europe, the Tiger I. Very few enemy weapons will scratch a Tiger's surface, roll over your opponent with your nigh invulnerable task force.

This box set will allow you to field two armoured platoons, both with immense anti-tank capability. Every tank in this bundle has a super heavy anti-tank gun, which would make them one of the biggest threats on the battlefield - able to take out literally any tank fielded by your enemy!

This starter set gives you a force worth over 2000 points! So this is a great kit to pick up whether you're starting new or continuing your current collection.

—description from the publisher's website

Name: Bolt Action: Tank War – Soviet Starter Set
Description:
With over 70,000 units produced the T-34 is famous for its unconventional design. When it arrived early in the war the T-34 became a threat that the German's just couldn't handle. Designed to replace the monster sized KV tank series, the IS-2 was just as big and heavy but was even nastier. Equipped with a massive 122mm gun, its intention was to be a breakthrough tank, demolishing fortifications and clearing enemy positions.

Two brutal armoured platoons come from this starter set, both with the potential to break entire armies. Forming the main battle line would be the IS-2s, with tough armour, a gargantuan 122mm gun and 3 machine guns, you can send this platoon to clear the path for the follow-up task force. Which would be the T-34 Squadron, who have plenty of armour and firepower to sweep away whatever remains.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bolt Action: Tank War – British Starter Set
Description:
American lend-lease allows the British to field the Sherman and British engineers improved these tanks even further, putting it's fire power above most American versions with the Sherman V Firefly, equipped with a 17-pdr cannon which was one of the most deadly anti-tank weapons of the war, capable of tearing through the heaviest of armour.

To match the German heavy tanks toe to toe, the British created the Churchill, one of the heaviest and sturdiest Allied tanks.

This starter set lets you field two armoured platoons, one full of impregnable Churchill tanks which will be at the front of your line taking an enormous amount of punishment, the other provides your tank destroyer capability, with the Firefly reliably taking out any target from over 1,000 m away. Using these two platoons in conjunction with one another creates a mobile platform of deadly, precise and efficient, high-value target destroying, objective holding, break through enemy line must have units for your army!

—description from the publisher

Name: Deplorables The Game
Description:
Whether you’re Democrat, Republican or somewhere in the middle, Deplorables The Game is a bipartisan election game we can all play together. To win, players will have to buy Democrat, Republican and Bipartisan political cards to accumulate 270 electoral votes. But beware, this game is fraught with dangers like Drain The Swamp and FBI Investigations!

Here's how the game works:

•Players start the game choosing either a Democrat or Republican candidate with a matching Endorsement Card and $1,200 to fund their campaign.

•The first political twist comes in the player’s choice to purchase Obamacare or not, which affects game play down the road, because players that opt out can be penalized. Players must then roll dice, land on a space, and buy the matching political card worth 20 electoral votes. The bipartisan spaces, like the CIA or Women’s March space, are worth more electoral votes – so try to buy those first!


•The spinner allows players to move the voter token around the wheel in the center of the board for extra goodies. Players can get cash, bonus points or are empowered to “Drain The Swamp,” stealing two political cards from an opponent.

•Players can also receive Kremlin Cash to help fund their campaign, but might find themselves the subject of an FBI investigation down the road, losing $500 and two political cards.

•The October Surprise Win: The final stage of the game is the October Surprise. This occurs when all the political spaces are owned, and there is nothing left to buy. Whenever a "Super Tuesday" is triggered on the board, the two players with the least number of electoral votes are forced to roll off against each. The player with the lowest roll is eliminated from in the game. This continues until one player has enough votes to win or is the last player standing.

Name: Giraffes in Scarves
Description:
How many scarves can you collect for your giraffe? Roll the dice, pick a card and build your giraffe in this fun counting and colour matching game. The winner is the player with the most scarves on their giraffe!

The exciting and engaging gameplay is sure to hold children's attention play after play, testing a number of different educational skills...from basic colour matching and counting to memory, strategy and turn taking. The quirky and beautifully illustrated giraffe characters are sure to provide lots of laughs too!

Designed for ages 4-7, Giraffes in Scarves offers the perfect balance between learning and fun! It can also be played by up to 6 players.

On a player's turn roll the dice and choose a card with a matching colored spot. If the card is a neck card, add it to your giraffe’s neck.

If you turn over your head card and there is no neck card on your giraffe, return it face down to the table and mix up the cards. If the head card matches your giraffe body and you have one more next cards, place the head at the top of your giraffe's neck. You can not add any more neck cards, but can continue to turn over cards on your turn.

If you turn over another player's head card and you do not have a finished giraffe, return the card face down to the table and mix up the cards. If you turn over a head card which matches another player’s giraffe body and your giraffe is already finished, place the head at the top of their giraffe. This will end their chances of adding any more scarves.

Play continues until all player’s giraffes are finished. Each player count show many scarves their giraffe is wearing.The winner is the player with he most scarves at the end of the game.

Contents:
24 neck cards
6 head cards
6 base boards
1 colour dice
1 instruction leaflet

Not suitable for children under 3 years due to small parts. Choking hazard.

Name: Hegemonia Senki
Description:
Unique clans fight for supremacy of the Hegemonian continent. You are the leader of the clans. Your goal is to lead your citizens and gain supremacy over Hegemony of Hegemonia. Lead your citizen, fend off other clans, occasionally negotiate, gather resources, expand your power, and eventually make your mark in history as the King of Hegemony.

To win:
The player who builds the first four bases wins.
 How to play:
 At the beginning of your turn, you turn over  resource cards from deck and place them on the corresponding land.
 Next, you take control of the land by moving your citizens and driving out your opponent's citizen.
 If your clan controls over half of the power in the land, you will receive the resources in that land.
 You can also diplomatically trade your resources with other players.
 You can use these resources to expand your power by increasing your citizen and your base.
 However, don't let your guard down, they will expand their power as well.
 The first clan to build four of their own bases by repeating their turn while taking advantage of their own clan's strengths is the winner.

The international complete edition will include 10 clans instead of 5.

Name: Joe Connaissant: Cinema
Description:
For lovers of cinema  (French)

384 questions that will allow you to showcase your knowledge.
Put your knowledge to the fore and wow your opponents! Nothing's worked out with the views guy. Stand up in front of the opposing team by answering as many questions as possible in 45 seconds.
Who wins? 
The team with the most points at the end of the fifth round.


Pour les amateurs de cinéma

384 questions qui vous permettront de faire l’étalage de vos connaissances.
Mettez votre savoir en tête d’affiche et épatez vos adversaires! Rien n’est arrangé avec le gars des vues. Pétez-vous les bretelles devant l’équipe adverse en répondant au plus de questions possible en 45 secondes.
Qui l’emporte? 
L’équipe ayant le plus de points à la fin de la cinquième manche.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hackin' Packin' Alpaca
Description:
Hackin' Packin' Alpaca is the hilarious kids' game with lots of cargo and one spittin' mad alpaca! To play, take turns stacking pieces of your cargo on Al the Alpaca's back. Watch the time, though -- this alpaca has a temper! To get started, turn Al's head to face the first player, then start the timer. You've got five seconds to stack a piece of cargo on his back. If you fail to stack a piece before the time runs out, Al will SPIT water at you! You'll have to use skill and touch to stack your pieces -- the game gets more challenging as more cargo is piled on Al's back. If you knock over any other pieces, you'll have to add them to your personal stockpile. The first player to stack all of their pieces wins -- can you do it before Al loses his temper?

—description from the publisher

Name: Virus War
Description:
Virus War is a 2-8 player merciless and hilarious board game. Get ready to put your friendships to the test in a very contagiously addictive tabletop game.

You’ll have to show unremitting determination to be the ultimate survivor of this viral war.

Contaminate your adversaries, get a vaccine, revenge yourself, sabotage any action of others players... The wide diversity of cards will perfectly match with your strategies to make every game ruthless and unique.

On your masks, get set, contaminate!

—description from the designer

Name: Escape the Labyrinth
Description:
A cooperative riddle labyrinth for children.

The players are trapped in the haunted maze. They have to reach the two sets of keys and then the exit. For this, they need to rotate the cards to change the paths.

The maze consists of 7x7 cards with routes (including a start card, two keys, and an exit). On his turn, a player first moves the (shared) player token along existing paths. Then he can rotate a path card; to do this, he must first take one of the task cards, and correctly solve the task on it. A task has also to be solved when reaching a set of keys, or the exit.

There are 5 different types of tasks; for example, finding a specific illustration in the maze, counting how often a symbol appears in a maze, or recognize the correct shadow image for an item. The back of the task card shows the correct solution.

The players win the game if they get out of the maze with at most two wrong tasks. Three wrong answers, and the game is lost.

Name: Ravens of Karnage
Description: Fast and easy-to-play rules for gaming fantasy battles in 15mm or 25mm. While designed especially for the land of Karnage and Black Raven Foundry miniatures, the rules will work with any other worlds or figures. Rules cover wizards & magic, creatures, champions, weather, and a points system for fighting battles of orcs, trolls, elves, dwarves and all sorts of other good and evil creations.

Name: Compound
Description:
Each card is a fragment of a real molecule. Create your own organic compound before it evaporates.

The goal of the game is to win as many cards as possible.

You have 6 pieces of molecules in your hand.

During their turn, each player must place one card from his hand.
The card placed must match the bonds of the other cards on the table, these bonds are used to build molecules.
When all the bonds have been connected, the molecule is complete.
The player who has put down the last card of a complete molecule wins the molecule.

When there are no more cards in the draw pile, the game ends. 
The player with the most points and therefore the most cards wins.

Name: Krasserfall
Description:
Welcome to the annual competition at the Krasserfall!
Everyone wants to be in the race, nobody wants to finish first.

Why? The end of the route is a thundering waterfall! Who doesn't wants to land in the safety net at the fall gives everything so that the boats with their own crew drift as slowly as possible towards the abyss. Or, better yet, he quickly changes boats, or has someone else change boats. Whoever wins six medals first wins the game!

Four boats are mounted on long sheer plastic stripes, with the far end over the table edge and weighted by a big fish. The boats are occupied by crew members of the players.

In turn, the players roll a die, and (depending on the roll) either move a boat towards the waterfall, or let a crew member switch the boat. At some point, the boats will slide towards and down the waterfall (table edge). The crew members of the last boat in the race score 1-2 points (depending on size).

A player wins when he reaches 6 points after multiple races.

Name: Nobody is Perfect: Extra Edition
Description:
Nobody is Perfect is a party game. Each round the start player draws a card with a complicated word or technical term on it, with the meaning of that word given on the card as well, but only visible to themselves. Everyone then invents an alternative meaning for that word and writes it down while the start players notes down the correct answer. They then presents all the explanations written down and asks everyone to choose between the answers. Each player then places a token on the answer they think is correct.

Nobody is Perfect: Extra Edition is a smaller edition of the base game, with components for up to six players.

Name: The Reckoners: Steelslayer
Description:
David Charleston, now known as “Steelslayer,” and the rest of the Reckoners attempt to bring human governance back to Newcago and continue on their quest to liberate the oppressed peoples of the Fractured States. However, the Epics will not be so easily stopped. With new allies and challenges ahead, can you live up to the Steelslayer name?

The Reckoners: Steelslayer is an expansion to The Reckoners board game containing four new modules. These elements can be added separately or together in any combination.

Module 1: New Reckoners
Module 2: New Equipment
Module 3: New Epics
Module 4: New Boss Epics & Cities

-description from publisher

Name: The Zorro Dice Game: Stunts and Allies
Description:
This expansion to The Zorro Dice Game gives each player an Ally, who will level up throughout the game, providing your hero with special abilities and a subtle catch-up mechanic. If your Ally reaches its max level, you will unlock your own, personal Ally Die as well. But each Ally has a weakness that you have to mitigate as you fight Scoundrels and Villains, which increases the difficulty of the game overall.

Stunt Tokens were added as well, which offer additional opportunities for mid-turn tactics, like switching Heroic Feats or re-rolling dice.

Lastly, it will add more Equipment, Scoundrels, and Villains to the base game as well for additional replayability and more combos to try in your overall strategy.

Name: Die Wälder von Carcassonne V2 (fan-erweiterung für Carcassonne)
Description:
The name already reveals it: In this expansion the forest is introduced as a new landscape feature. But Andreas was not satisfied with that, because e.g. with the avenues as new road maps, the pyre or the trees there are some more features.
The design of Andreas was not used for following expansions.

Name: Fearless Creatures: B is for Biome Pack
Description:
An 18 card set of biospheres that represent individual creatures, groups of creatures, creature capabilities. Some standalone, some interact with other creature cards, and some alter the status of the game.

Expands the base Fearless Creatures card game with more variety and adds an element of mystery.

Name: Clan War: Unicorn Army Expansion
Description:
Clan War: Unicorn Army Expansion is a source book containing all the information needed to play a Unicorn Clan army in Clan War

     history, 
     units,
     organization, and
     tactics

Name: The Shipwreck Arcana: The Restless Hours Promo Card
Description:
An alternate Hours card delivered with Atma RPG Kickstarter, with Atma-themed art and the variant Doom rules from the PnP on Shipwreck Arcana site.

Alternate rules for "doomed" difficulty.

Setup:
1. Shuffle the deck of arcana cards.
2. Remove all but 15 cards from the game.
3. Begin play as normal, but without the doom tracker.

Gameplay:
- Whenever doom would be accrued, instead remove that many cards from the bottom of the deck.
- When a faded power is used, remove it from the game instead of returning it to the bottom of the deck.

Winning/losing:
- Players win when they reach 7 points.
- Players lose if no deck remains when a card fades or doom is accrued.

Name: The Capitals Game
Description:
The Capitals Game contains 193 Flash cards representing the recognized countries of the world (by the UN). Each card shows the flag on the back along with country details on the front.

What can you do on those long trips in the car? How can you help your kids learn more about the world?
The Capital Game allows a family to interact and learn more about the world around them.

There are unlimited ways you can play this game but the most popular are:
Who’s Flag is this?
What is the Capital of?
Guess the Country?
Biggest Wins
Countries (or capitals) by the Alphabet

The deck also comes with blank cards allowing you to hide the front (or back of the
cards) to keep other players guessing.
Each card has the flag on one side and some information about the country on the other:
Name
Capital City
Approx Population (2020)
Currency
GDP
Main Languages
Land Mass Size
Location on the globe

It also shows membership of:
G20
OECD
WTO
APEC
NATO
Commonwealth

Name: Butterfly Effect
Description:
Butterfly Effect is the game of Unintended Consequences. A hilarious game where you put your mind to the test. Can you explain what happened? Use your quick wits and a healthy dose of the ridiculous. Fun for friends and family as you compete to see who can master the CHAOS.

How to play:
The Butterfly Effect (also known as Chaos Theory) came from an age old saying - A butterfly flaps its wings in China causing a Tornado in America. This is the idea that a small change can create far reaching ramifications somewhere else.
So how do you play?
It’s very easy to play. Each player gets handed out a series of cards:
A Person 
An Action 
A Start Location 
Players take it in turns with the first player putting down 2 cards:
A Disaster 
A Destination 
The other players then have to select a Person, Action and Start Location set of cards to create a story of how the Disaster happened at the Destination location.

—description from the publisher

Name: Fearless Creatures: Add Players Pack
Description:
An expansion pack for Fearless Creatures that adds support for playing games with 3 or 4 players.

Extra cards for herd animals from the base game (and other expansions), plus some cards that are unique to this pack.

—description from the designer

Name: Fearless Creatures: P is for Panda Pack
Description: An expansion pack for Fearless Creatures that mostly adds pandas (red panda, giant panda, brown panda, trash panda, panda ant), but also adds some new places and some new creatures.

Name: Last War: West – Cold War in Europe 1945-1989 WPO & NATO
Description:
"Last war: West" is a Chinese board wargame based on the Cold War, simulated from middle to the end of the 20th century.

Players will play the role of the highest staff of the two camps in this game, command the troops of the countries they belong to, and simulate the confrontation between Warsaw Pact and NATO during the peak standoff of the Cold War.

This work is based on the division and brigade level. It focuses on combing firepower and combat processes, and introducing more reasonable and operational air force mechanisms to get rid of the "Cold War drived by World War II system" criticized by players. Through the gradual disclosure of military information in the past 30 years since the end of the Cold War in real world, we could restored the fight against both sides in If... history  as realistically as possible.

Name: Pitcoin
Description:
Trade cards with between two and five other players to be the first to collect the entire set of one cryptocurrency. Inspired byt the classic game, Pit, trades are carried out blind and simultaneously with all players in this frantic party game.

Each cryptocurrency has a value and the first player to 500 wins. But be careful, because the value of each coin fluctuates and players can use the 'Crash the Market' card to boost the value of their holdings and destroy their opponents'.

Players can also use the 'Blockchain' card to temporarily halt trading and see what another player is holding in their hand.

—description from the publisher

Name: WheelVille
Description:
How would our little-big planet look like without us, its inhabitants?
And what happens here and now, when the responsibility for its well-being rests with us more than ever?
WheelVille is not just another board game. It has its own philosophy: when you take something from your environment, you need to replace it with an equally valuable thing. You need to regenerate.
Give it all you’ve got to realize the full potential of the small village of WheelVille. Don’t be a mere player; be an entrepreneur!
However, the resources at your disposal are not infinite. And this is the challenge of the game – maintaining the balance. Developing your business in harmony with nature’s well-being.
Play your part in the big game of saving our planet. Be inspired, contemplate, innovate!
Welcome to WheelVille!

Name: Party Bowl
Description:
Three rounds, two teams, and one Party Bowl! In this instant classic from What Do You Meme?, players use prompt cards to come up with a bunch of words or phrases which get thrown in the Party Bowl. Two teams then compete to out-guess each other in three increasingly high-pressure rounds of fun.

Family friendly: This game is part of What Do You Meme?®’s lineup of family-friendly games! Perfect for family game night, game night with friends, and gatherings of all kinds. Designed for ages 12+ to be as risqué (or not) as you like.

—description from the publisher

Name: Coconut Pirate
Description:
Coconut Pirate is a visual agility game. Each player has a group of dices with sides of colors and different icons. Every player's turn it throws a dice and the first locating a combination of three dices with the same colour or icons claims it. If more than one combination found, claim it saying the number of combinations.

The fastest player gets the dices and moves its pirate token in the scoring path, the "Treasure map", the same number of steps as the combinations found. The first one to reach the top wins.

Name: Say What?!: The Adult Party Game!
Description:
Say What?! The Adult Party Game!

The adult party game about conjuring up clues about ridiculously disgusting cards with sneaky deceptions and challenging bids.

Contents: 250 cards, 150 betting chips and a bottle opener to mark the correct card.

Go from party zero, to party hero – and reap the rewards that come along with Party Champ status.

An unsavory, nauseating and unwholesome specimen of a card game. Not to be confused with a savory, uneasy and wholesome legume.


     Each player gets 10 of the sick and twisted cards, enough voting cards as there are players, and 10 green chips.
     On your go pick one of your cards and say a clue about the card. The clue can be anything like “This is something Dave would do.” or “If my wife caught me doing this then she would probably join in.” or “This card is like something from Jurassic Park.” or if you don’t have much imagination then you can just say “This is very painful.”. The clue shouldn’t be too obvious or too obscure so finding the perfect balance is crucial.
     Place your card face down on the table. All other players then choose one card from their hand that closely matches the clue. All cards are placed face down on the table and shuffled together.
     All cards are then dealt face up on the place holder cards which are lettered A-F (for up to 6 players).
     Once all ridiculous cards have been read out it is then time for all other players to choose a letter card and bet some chips on which card you think the initial clue was about.
     Once all players have placed their bets with the somewhat strange betting chips the original card is revealed by placing the bottle opener on it.
     All players can now reveal which card they thought it was by turning over their letter card. The players that guessed the correct card win the same amount of chips that they bet.
     The players that guessed incorrectly have to give all of their bet chips to the player who played the card that misdirected them.
     The winner is the player with the most chips!

Name: Chevrons
Description:
2 players Red and Blue

A hexagonal board made up of triangles. A supply of Red chevrons and Blue chevrons and supply of Red and Blue cubes.

Play
Red moves first. Then turns alternate.

On a turn place a chevron in your color on the board along 2 edges that meet at 120 degrees. A chevron cannot be placed so that it is fully or partially inside of a previously enclosed area.

An area of empty cells encircled by edges of both colors counts for the player with the most edges bordering it. Once an area is encircled it is immediately claimed by placing a cube in a player's color within the area. This includes areas that are encircled simultaneously for either player.

The game ends when a player is unable to take his turn.

Scoring
Players count all the triangular cells within their claimed areas.

Open areas (areas not fully encircled) and areas encircled with an equal number of Blue and Red edges are not counted.

The player encircling the greater number of cells is the winner.

-description from designer

Name: 1,000 Year Beard: The Whisker Wizard
Description:
Advanced rules and cards for 1,000 Year Beard. Powerful new player cards allow for more fantastic beard-growing options. The new Pocket cards add varied boosted-actions and let Dwarfs hold an extra card!

PnP files found on record for 1,000 Year Beard

-description from designer

Name: Der Kraftkönig
Description:
The game pieces are black on one side and white on the other side. The starting player sets one piece with his color on top in the center space. This is the powerking (Kraftkönig). Then the players set alternately pieces of their color on the 8 spaces surrounding the powerking (satellites). Then the game spreads to the outer area. Each player may place a piece adjacent to an enemy piece, thereby enclosing a number of enemy pieces between two own pieces. The enclosed pieces (including, should the situation arise, the powerking and his satellites) are turned over to change their color. The game ends when all spaces are occupied.

The players are awarded points for any pieces of their color: 1 point for each piece in the outer area, 9 points for the powerking and 3 points for each of his satellites.

The player with the most points wins the game.

This game is a variant of "Reversi" and was released in booklet format in "Bunkerspiele Heft 2 - Spiele unter Kameraden" with the game board and cut-out game pieces in the back of the booklet.

—user summary

Name: Gùgōng: Deluxe Big Box
Description: The Big Box contains all components of the GùgÅng: Deluxe Edition and the GùgÅng: PànjÅ«n Deluxe Edition, all packaged in a gorgeous velvet covered, 3 mm thick box, embossed with gold foil graphic elements.
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: Tramways: Tile Expansion Packs
Description:
This is the latest expansion for Tramways suggested by the fans, designed and released with the help of the boardgames community:

ALL tiles are printed both sides with different tiles to add even more variety .when you combine them!

Tile expansion pack 1 contains 39 NEW TILES:
1 x Clinic Tile
2 x Vulcano tiles
2 x Railroad Cross Tiles + 1 Black disc
8 x Multicolored city Tiles
5 x Lake Tiles
6 x Forest Tiles
5 x Mountain Tiles
6 x River Tiles
4 x New Building Tiles
A set of rules

Tile Expansion pack 2 contains 6 OLD TILES:
2 x Airport tiles
1 x Fun Fair tile
1 x Park Tile
1 x Stock Exchange Tile
1 x Grand Station Tile
A set of rules

Both Packs can be combined with ALL cover flaps (Grand Station, Blue Commerce, Green Residence, Yellow Industry and Red Leisure)

For example you could make a city with 4 Airports, 2 Volcanos and a long long river...

Name: FUTURES
Description:
Futures is a standalone card game of transformative storytelling. You will create and share stories of future worlds that are different from the one you know. You will create space for alternative realities, and collectively envision a future world where we actually want to live. Together, you will smile, laugh, think, and cry, ultimately feeling inspired and ready to go out and change the world.

Futures helps you to tell your story of transformative worlds never before seen or talked about. You already have the courage, and Futures will help you to see.

—description from the publisher

Name: Clinic Expansion: Medical Dossier 4
Description:
This Medical Dossier 4 has been designed for the fans who love the 1st Edition of Clinic and still want to complete the collection of extensions.

It is packed in the same beige Dossier than the other Medical Dossier #1, #2, and #3.

It contains:

- All Stretch goals unlocked during the Clinic Deluxe Edition campaign (4 Workaholic purple Doctors, 8 Blood rectangles, and 8 Red Cylinders for the extinguishers, and 8 lime green Zombies).

- All the components of the Clinic Deluxe Extension 4, released for the Essen fair 20:
4 Basement player boards printed both side with the old illustrations from Sampo Sikïo
9 Double tiles with the old illustrations from Sampo Sikïo
A set of English rules.
This set is only compatible with the 1st edition of Clinic released in 2014 (tiles size, components illustrations, commun boards and player boards). You need to have Clinic 1st Edition.

You need to have Clinic 1st Edition.

Limited to 100 copies.

Name: Lord of the Things
Description:
Declare yourself the Lord of… basically whatever you want in this fast-paced party game – just make sure the Overlord approves! Whether you are the Lord of Hairstyles; Lord of Barnyard Animal Noises; Lord of Body Parts; or the Lord of Things that Come in Pairs, be prepared to intimidate, distract, and out-think your opponents to call out something in their category before they call out something in yours.

One player is randomly selected as the Overlord for the first round – this role then rotates each round. All players declare themselves the Lord of some category (such as Lord of Party Games; Internet Slang Acronyms; or Countries in South America; Currencies; etc.), and the Overlord can either approve or deny Lordships, ensuring a reasonable familiarity with the topic among all players.

Each player has a stack of wooden Thing Tokens and a dice in front of them. One person rolls their dice at a time, and when two dice match, those Lords are in a duel. To win a duel, you have to take something from the other Lord’s category before they take something from yours by being the first to say, “I shall have your ________________;” and naming something from your opponent’s category. The Overlord is responsible for settling any disputes and breaking ties. The winning Lord takes the Thing Token at the top of their opponent’s stack, adding it to their point line. The winning Lord then rolls their dice, and play continues.

The end-game battle for bonus points is triggered when any player reaches 15 points, and players grab for the bonus stars in the center of the table. Points are tallied and a new round begins. Play as many rounds as your elevated blood pressure can handle. The player with the most points at the end wins.

-description from designer

Name: Monopoly: Sevilla FC
Description:
A Monopoly about the Sevilla Fútbol Club, created in 1890.

Play classic Monopoly, but this time being a professional sports manager. Invest in stands and stadiums, rent and spend the money in the official store.

Roll the dice and move around the board thanks to the pawns and travel through the best of the history of Sevilla F.C. -  stadiums, best players, and the great victories in team history.

Name: Monopoly: FC Porto
Description:
If your admiration for the FC Porto exceeds the limits of the pitch, consider yourself invited to play in this board game!

Conquer properties like you win titles, with the blue and white jersey, in this exclusive edition of Monopoly F.C. Porto

Se a tua admiração pelo clube do Porto ultrapassa os limites do relvado, considera-te convocado para jogares neste jogo de tabuleiro!

Conquista propriedades como quem conquista títulos, com a camisola azul e branca vestida, nesta edição exclusiva do Monopoly F.C. Porto

Name: Ultreïa! Le Jeu des Chemins de Saint-Jacques-de-Compostelle
Description:
Ultreïa!
Be the first to reach Santiago de Compostela as you progress on the pilgrimage routes that cross France and Spain.
In the footsteps of the pilgrims of the Middle Ages, brave the vagaries of the road, and discover the history of St James by answering the questions that mark your journey!

Contents: 5 route boards, 105 questions, 25 Hazard cards, 30 immunity cards, 1 die, 4 pawns, and instructions.

Ultreïa ! Soyez le premier à atteindre Saint-Jacques-de-Compostel
le en progressant sur les chemins de pèlerinage qui traversent la France et l’Espagne. 
Dans les pas des pèlerins du Moyen Âge, bravez les aléas de la route, et découvrez l’histoire jacquaire en répondant aux questions qui jalonnent votre parcours !

Name: That's My Sundae!
Description:
That’s My Sundae! is a dessert dreamland where everyone screams for ice cream! Indulge in your very own sundae swirl creation with this engaging, easy-to-learn card game that guarantees a bowl full of family fun.

Score points by building the sweetest sundae in the game! A crunchy waffle cone topped with cookie dough ice-cream and whipped cream will have your opponents licking their lips with dessert-envy. But, watch out for melted scoops, broken cones, or striking brain freeze which could take a bite out of your points! Save your sundae from the dessert destroyers by locking your complete sundae and keep their sticky fingers off your ice-cream with the signature “That's My Sundae!” card.

The best sundae wins the prize for earning the most points!

-description from publisher's website

Players will play two cards from their hand which could be sundae component cards (cone, ice cream, toppings) to build complete sundaes and/or action cards, but watch out, there are cards that can be played against you that can ruin or steal sections of your sundae. At the end of each turn, players will draw back up to their hand limit.

Each round will end once a player completes a specific number of sundaes (varies based on player count). Players will add up the points of their played cards each round (completed and not completed sundaes). After three rounds, who ever has the most points win!

-user summary

Name: Munchkin Warhammer: Age of Sigmar – Chaos and Order
Description: No conflict defines the Age of Sigmar like the battles between the forces of Chaos and Order. This expansion for Munchkin Warhammer Age of Sigmar showcases one fan-favorite army from each side of this war: the Kharadron Overlords, dwarves who mine for gold in the skies above the Mortal Realms, and the Bloodbound of Khorne, crimson-streaked warriors who fight anyone and everyone, including each other.

Name: DIVOC
Description:
DIVOC was designed during the Covid-19 lockdowns in Spain.
Due to its victory condition (arrange pieces into a single group), Cameron Browne called it an anti-social distancing game, therefore its name (Covid in reverse).

MATERIAL (depending on the edition):

- A 7x7 square board
- 24 white stackable pyramids
- 24 black stackable pyramids

GAME OVERVIEW

Randomly place the pyramids leaving the centre space empty (there are some constraints for this, so please refer to the official rulebook).

Players take turns jumping with their top pyramids onto other pyramids or empty spaces on the same line or column, with the aim of arranging all their top pyramids into a single connected group (not diagonals).

The game can accomodate more players.

Name: Mage Knight Rebellion: Atlantis Guild Army Expansion
Description: This is a 8 figure, pre-painted, 200 point Atlantean army plus one random rare figure from the Rebellion (Mage Knight 1st edition) set and a strategy guide for the Atlantean army.

Name: DNGN
Description:
DNGN is a solitaire print and play euro-inspired dungeon crawler with a minimalist style and a branching campaign.

The player assigns cubes to Action Slots on Skill and Equipment cards each turn, determining the Actions they want to take. Each card has three Action Slots, but they must be filled from left to right on each card. Some Action Slots are Exhausting, and will make the cube assigned to them unavailable next turn, and others can only be activated by special Mana Cubes which must first be gained with another Action. Once cubes have been assigned, a Behaviour card is drawn, describing what Monsters will do turn. Only once this is revealed does the Player take her Actions, which may not now be the most efficient choices.

After the Player has performed her Actions, Monsters resolve their Behaviours according to fixed rules, with four different AI types for different types of Monsters, and unique monster behaviours leading to them behaving in very varied ways.
